definition[0]: to sit with your knees bent under you and your bottom just off the ground, balancing on your feet
example[0]: He squatted down beside the little girl.
definition[1]: to live in a building or on a piece of land without permission and without paying rent
definition[2]: short and thick or low and wide, especially in a way which is not attractive
definition[4]: a house that people are living in without permission and without paying rent
example[3]: She lives in a squat in Camden.
definition[5]: nothing, or nearly nothing. Squat is often used in negative sentences for emphasis
example[4]: He had a job that paid him squat.
example[5]: You donâ€™t know squat about it.
example[6]: There are people squatting in the house next door.
